intro: Ophiorrhiza tenelliflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered ophiorrhiza, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its morphology includes a short stem with opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Ophiorrhiza tenelliflora is often found in wetlands and is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical climates.
